Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa M Keuffer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court.  
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Melissa M Keuffer.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference. 
Defense request a resolution hearing. 
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Parties advised this hearing will be held in persoN.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court.  
Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Melissa M Keuffer.  
Attorney William Ackell for Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request an adjournment.
State will send defense a Global Offer. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:41 PM Defendant Melissa M Keuffer appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Melissa M Keuffer.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Majerle. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case remains calendared for status 10/4/2022 at 8:30am in Br. 19. Case is adjourned to Branch 19.

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Melissa M Keuffer.  Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). 
Court order matter to adjourn for a Preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with VMA and AJS.
for a no contact order.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision:
-No firearm and/or dangerous weapon.
-No contact with VA and AS.

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for Melissa M Keuffer.  Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten for Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for doctor's Report Return. Doctor's Report received and filed. Doctor's report read by parties. Parties do not dispute the findings and Court reinstates the proceedings. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court sets bail to $300.00. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19. Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case Calendar for Doctor's Return on 10-12-2022.
Court in receipt of Competency report subject to the 14 day statutory time frame.
Parties contacted via email. State to do an OTP. Doctor's Report Return Hearing scheduled 9-15-2022 at 1:30pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Case calendared for a Doctor's Return on 10-12--2022. 
Court is now in receipt the Competency Report and which is subject to the 14 day statutory timeframe.
New date selected with defense.  State advised OTP is needed via email. 
Doctor's Report Return scheduled September 19, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.   The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. Case ajdourned to Branch 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Court will be down on July 11th, 2022 and that the Doctor's Report Return will need to be rescheduled. Court corresponded with parties via email to rescheduled. Case rescheduled for July 6th, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return. The court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to become competent within the statutory time period.  if provided with appropriate treatment, is likely to become competent within 12 months or within the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less. The court orders the proceedings suspended and committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months, or the maximum sentence specified for the most serious offense, whichever is less.  Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed and filed.
Case adjourned to Doctor's Report Return at 8:30 a.m. for review hearing in Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.
Letter from Wisconsin Forensic Unit stating the defendant would not be able to be evaluated until 3/29/22, therefore court is adjourning the return on Dr. Report in br 45.   mn
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.
Received and Filed. Competency Evaluation Extension Letter

Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Melissa M Keuffer in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 29.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
